data_visualization_main module¶

In this module we implemented a user window for the analysis of the competition database with some usefull functions to plot relevant features, compute the most important quantities (such as profit) and study the correlation between features.

data_visualization_main.activity_choice()[source]¶

This fuction prints a list of activity on the dataset and return a value corresponding to the choosen activity.

data_visualization_main.boxplot_main(data)[source]¶

This function is used to build the boxplot of main features. The user can decide if save or not the figure obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe

data_visualization_main.compute_profit(d_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)[source]¶

This function compute the maximum possible profit in terms of the variables recommended in the competition evaluation page. :param d_frame: The dataset in which we want to find the maximum profit :type d_frame: Pandas dataframe

Yields

  • days (int) – Time range considered in terms of trading days

  • val_u – Value of the maximum possible utility

data_visualization_main.corr_filter(d_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, bound: float)[source]¶

This function analyzes the correlation between the features and identifies the highly correlated features. :param d_frame: The dateset on which we evaluate the features correlation. :type d_frame: Pandas dataframe :param bound: This bound identifies our correlation range. :type bound: float

Yields

  • data_flattened (Pandas series) – The series which contains feature pairings with a correlation >bound or <-bound.

  • data_corr (Pandas DataFrame) – Correlation matrix.

data_visualization_main.correlation_analysis(data)[source]¶

This function prints higly correlated feature pairings

data_visualization_main.daily_avarage(d_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)[source]¶

This function computes the daily avarage values of each feature. :param d_frame: The dataset on which we compute our daily average quantities. :type d_frame: Pandas dataframe

Yields

day_mean (Pandas dataframe) – The dataframe composed by the daily average values.

data_visualization_main.hist_anon_features(data)[source]¶

This function is used to plot histograms about anonymous features distributions. The user can decide if save or not the figures obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe

data_visualization_main.hist_main_features(data)[source]¶

This function is used to plot histograms about main features distributions, particularly the categorical features: action and feature 0. The user can decide if save or not the figures obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe

data_visualization_main.missing_data_analysis(data, threshold)[source]¶

This function is used to identify features with a number of missing values over a threshold and build the relative bar plots. The user can decide if save or not the figure obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe :param threshold: Threshold choosen for the selection of features with most missing values. :type threshold: float

data_visualization_main.plot_anon_features(data)[source]¶

This function is used to plot the anonymous features over time (to see if there are some patterns). The user can decide if save or not the figures obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe

data_visualization_main.plot_main_features(data)[source]¶

This function is used to plot main features over time in terms of cumultaive sum of resp. The user can decide if save or not the figures obtained. :param data: The dataset we are working on. :type data: Pandas dataframe

data_visualization_main.save_data_options(data, name_save)[source]¶

This fuction is used for the save options of a dataframe as .cvs. :param object: Dataframe we want to save or not. :type object: Pandas dataframe :param name_save: Figure’s name. :type name_save: string

data_visualization_main.save_oneplot_options(name_save)[source]¶

This fuction is used for the save options and visualization of a single plot. :param name_save: Figure’s name. :type name_save: string

data_visualization_main.save_plots_options(names_save)[source]¶

This fuction is used for the save options and visualization of some plots. :param names_save: List in which we stored figures’ names. :type names_save: list

data_visualization_main.statistical_matrix(d_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame)[source]¶

This function returns a Pandas dataframe containing useful statistical informations about the dataset (mean, median, max , min etc…). :param d_frame: The dataset we want to describe. :type d_frame: Pandas dataframe

Yields

new_matrix (Pandas dataframe) – The dataframe in which we save all the information about our dataset.
